positive.review: A cute little desktop idle game. Is it a must-have? No. But do you want to pet little alpacas and unlock all the animals? Definitely yes.

I use my laptop all day at school and seeing all the adorable animals chilling out at the bottom of my screen has done wonders for my little joy-deprived brain. I've gotten so much use out of this game, and I recommend picking it up if you want an idle game that doesn't take up too much screen space or brain space.

Awesome game. Great visuals and idea, a fun idle game while being immensely wholesome and comes with many different types of animals and crossovers

The decors are cute [and interactive!] and the whole mechanism like breeding compounding coins and the fact that you get to have multiple pastures + do size adjustments of the pasture to fit your screen makes it even more flexible for any display

Not to mention being compatible with both Windows and MacOS! Great game, great value for money, and just so fun

Only downside - too addictive so I play less now XD

After owning the game for just one day, I adored it so much that I programmed it to launch on startup, so that my little animal friends will always be with me whenever I'm on the computer.

The achievements are all attainable, just that it will take some time to earn the money needed in the game. But I don't mind that this game will last longer, in fact I am aiming for my own additional achievements - to own one rainbow level animal of every specie and colour.

The game is supposed to stay idle and unobtrusive at the bottom of your screen. But I keep watching my animals and clicking on them. My productivity has dropped dramatically. My future may be ruined.

Definitely recommend.

‚≠ê Tiny Pasture Review ‚≠ê

 I bought this game on sale and honestly, it‚Äôs one of the best blind buys you can make. It‚Äôs super cheap even without the discount  and the DLCs are really worth it too. üêë

It‚Äôs a very cozy game that makes time fly pleasantly. The gameplay is surprisingly addictive, especially in the beginning when you take your animals for walks and unlock new ones through tasks. It doesn‚Äôt use much RAM or storage space, which is a nice bonus. üíæ

The base game is quite short, but with the DLCs there‚Äôs plenty of extra content to enjoy.

üí° Tip: Try to unlock Ropuka as fast as you can. He costs 720 to buy, but if you sell him with one star, you get 9600 back! You can repeat this and basically get unlimited gold üí∞

Enjoy and have fun! üåøüéÆ

I love this game with a very large part of my heart. Collecting the little furry friends, while (not getting much work done) is such a great way to spend my time! There is a little glitch every so often that blacks out portions of the game, but it doesn't last super long, just a little bug. Otherwise, its so cute!!

Relaxing, Cute, Nice tunes, Very ChiLL

Looking forward to different biomes and more animals
Very cozy and relaxing game. only probem is that it's more intresting then thing that you're doing in foreground. also props for polishing the price ^^

It‚Äôs a chill and cute game. The animals are adorable, and it‚Äôs really fun to just sit back, relax, and let it run while I do my own thing.
Definitely a 10/10 for me.

simple and cute.
I run it like an interactive wallpaper

I love this little idle game.
The animations are adoreble and suit all the different species very well.
I usually have it running while drawing digitally and the little activity down at the bottom of my screen is very soothing to watch.
The new seasonal items give a great new spark and colour scheme to the farm and I am looking forward to have more different little farms, all with their own flair.
For the little money this game costs it is totally, totally worth it! ‚ô•
Really cute game that should be an idle feel but sometimes consumes every waking second because I need the rainbow animals....

Absolutely lovely little game! If you have trouble concentrating during D&D, watching videos, or anything in between, then this game is perfect for that right amount of something to do whilst not taking up too much space <3
Super adorable game! I really love having it run while I have to work on my computer!
Cute and entertaining! Simple and cozy gameplay that's great to leave hanging around while you work, absolutely worth the price.

If you just want something to enjoy at the bottom of your screen that isn't to distracting, while you do some homework, this is a great choice. Cozy and cute, great to have running while you do other things. Also if you enjoy achievement hunting like myself, there's several here that are easy to do, if you take the time to do them.
Great game, good for calming down! Nice to have in the background while doing other things
Cute game, not complex or complicated. Idle game that I was excited to check in on every once in a while.

its such a great game for people who are learning to take care of pets (with out the money of course) but its great and good for snuggling up in a blanket and being a lil introvert on a soft video game :3

Honestly one of the best less-involved games I've experienced. 

I have roughly 90+ hrs into it, and while I am less impressed with the absolute brutal RNG in the highest quality pulls - I don't dislike this mechanic. In fact, there's enough here to dampen the burn of loosing 3 mil in-game currency in my relentless spree for a highest quality fox or two. I like the attainability of most of the achievements, I would like to have more achievements that weren't so in-game wealth based, though. The animations that are unique to each animal hold the charm of the game entirely. I mean, who doesn't want to click on a red panda going "Uppies!" - love it. 

What I want: More customization. I want more backdrops to choose from/obtain through diversified methods (not just in-game wealth based), ability to size my windows by dragging rather than the built in perspectives (their either too big or too small and not quite right for me). I want to see more to do beyond breeding and pulling the highest quality animal once your past the initial gameplay. It would be neat if there was a character you created to then "care" for the pasture(s) (some more personalization).
Neat "cozy" casual game to have running in the foreground while you use your PC.  Cute art style and fun game loop.
Watching the tiny pets (rabbits, foxes, capybaras, slimes or zombies) scampering, sleeping or chilling is just so cute. Their little animations bring such a cozy, comforting vibe.
relaxing, cute, and cozy
love the game, the bottom of the screen with colofur animals
Very cute. Take a bit of time before you can truly leave the game on idle.
relaxing, cute, can be played while working, not too distracting and still feels like playing game
Such a cozy idle game, I recommend for people looking to have an idle application needing few interactions during the day
Cute game, love the animals! Nice to have on screen when doing other tasks, can't wait to get more and more cute animals and pet them all!
Super kawaii. Once you get a pasture up and running it's all very self-sufficient. I love watching my animal or fish friends at the bottom of my screen just enjoying life.

Awesome game to have if you use your laptop everyday, I enjoyed having this game a lot as it is adorable to watch when I am doing my work on my laptop. All the animals are so cute the way they wonder around at the bottom of my laptop, I enjoyed this game the ,ost out of all the other ones I have bought along the way. I would recommend it to anyone that enjoy this kind of genre and uses their computer/laptop a lot.
Super cute game! Collecting all the variables of each animal is fun :)

Tiny Pastutr est une v√©ritable petite perle ! Le jeu r√©ussit √† offrir une exp√©rience √† la fois relaxante, mignonne et √©tonnamment addictive. La boucle de gameplay est simple, mais incroyablement satisfaisante : g√©rer, am√©liorer, r√©colter, construire‚Ä¶ et voir petit √† petit notre petit monde prendre vie. Visuellement, c‚Äôest un charme total. Le style artistique est doux, accueillant, et les animations rendent chaque action vivante et plaisante. On ressent l‚Äôamour et l‚Äôattention mis dans les d√©tails.

En bref : Tiny Pastutr est un must pour tous ceux qui aiment les jeux cosy, la gestion l√©g√®re et un univers qui fait du bien. Un vrai petit bijou.

Incredibly charming little game! Tiny Pasture is the ‚ÄúI‚Äôll only have it under my page‚Äù and somehow i end up playing an hour without noticing.Adorable animals, simple activities, and a cozy vibe that helps you handle some stress from tasks. No pressure, no rush... just expanding your pasture at your own pace.

very cute small game running on your task bar. However it can get a little bit exhausting and boring because you need money to buy decoration,food,facilities and more animals which the animals gather over time (slow or fast depending on animal and stage of the animal) so you definetly need to keep track and feed said animals. So i¬¥d suggest leveling up your facilities first so at some point you can just keep the game running and the feeding etc. happens automatically. Art work is insanely cute but the execution could definitely be better. None the less still a thumbs up and a must buy if on sale! :)

This game is a little desktop idle game that gives fun, cute, and cozy vibes. Is it the most exciting game? No, but its a wonderful desktop companion when you're life is staring at a pc screen. Little details like the surface of the water moving when your mouse scrolls over it add a spark of whimsy to a simple and cute game. And its details like that make this game stand out as an idle game. It makes me smile every time I look at my collection of adorable animals. Like I said: Cute, fun, and simple. 10/10

This is a cute little game. The first one or two hours requires you to click around a lot to get coins from the animals, selling the adult pets away and get young ones to raise, the newly unlocked species will produce more coins. After setting up the building to automatically get coins, clean up poops, and drop food, you can basically let your pets running free at the bottom of your screen without doing much.
The game mechanic is pretty minimal with cozy animation, and I think that's good for its purpose.

It's a simple idle game to have tiny animal roam around your desktop while you work. The designs of the animals fit the style, the achievements are all manageable to get (with mods it would speed things up). And overall, if you want a simple interactive screensaver to keep an eye on while you work, this game's for you.

This game is very different from the casual games; I wasn't prepared for such cuteness available when watching movies, writing e-mails, and working on my computer. It's like having Tamagotchi pet's for you to enjoy right above your taskbar.
Sit back, relax, enjoy all the critters and animals running back and forth on your desktop. feeding them, patting them, even breeding them. gotta need a lot more animals variants heheh cute!!
Game is good, animals are cute, dlc kinda sad.

A cute little desktop game where you can listen to music, study, write, or create while you watch your lil guys grow and run around. You can also decorate and make your farm more efficient to collect rarer animals.

It's a very nice and relaxing little desktop farm that sits just above your taskbar on the desktop. You can adjust it's location and size on the screen to suit your workflow. It's easy to get started and add some animals and decoration; there's even "some" automations for feeding and cleanup. It actually only requires however much time you want to give it. I really enjoy it, just seeing the critters run around the bottom of my screen. Maybe you will too. Kind regards.

[h1]Tiny Pasture is a fine Idler[/h1] 

No expectations, no hassle....just cute Bunnies earning Money for it¬¥s owner!
Grab them!

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198050907477/inventory#3083090_2_706630190695461376] Coin[/url]
Adorable desktop idle game. Lot of cute cute animals.

Cute. Lots of fun seasonal updates. Wish it had more achievements for some of the DLC. Maybe later? 

I hope there are more expansions or DLC. I enjoyed collecting all the coloured animals, but now that i have them all i'm making each biome pretty.

I adore this game, its very adorable and wholesome and a great idle game / interactive wallpaper. It's perfect for when you are doing tasks or simply chilling at your computer. The free DLCs are also a plus.
Cute animals and free DLC, amazing for relaxing.

I play on an intel mac and this is becoming a problem for a lot of games.  This one works flawlessly!  It even goes to my primary monitor without me having to move it there from my laptop.  It's super cute, fun to breed my little animals and set up new pastures but honestly for me it wins first on running flawlessly.  Well done!
This game is very simple and cute. Adorable animals play at the bottom of your screen that you can interact with.

Sprite work in this game is SO cute! DLC even added water creatures/features!

One of the first idle games I think I've ever purchased & it has features i never knew I needed until i played other idler games like this. 

There is an element of rng that can be frustrating in game like this where you're missing just this one thing, but the purchase power you have at the shop lets you skip all that provided you have enough money to keep the autopurchaser running. 

Mods are also supported in the workshop & there are some ADORABLE and game changing ones available. The pasture expansion one is a must download.
This is a cute game. Easy to follow and doesn't take much effort. Great for keeping on your desktop when watching boring work videos or while on a zoom call.

I got this game 3 days ago and haven't closed it since. I love all the cute animals and trying to most efficiently get them all to rainbow. I haven't even started on the fish DLC! Great game for a good price. For sure focus on upgrading the facilities and it makes this an idler game which is super nice.

Nice and cosy game.

Only thing that really bugs me is that some of the animals / creatures seem to go "below the ground level". Some walk on the ground just fine, but some are kind of only partly visible and seem to be missing their lower parts. I've tried to look the settings of the game, but nope, all is ok there and nothing I can do about it, so the game just is like that. Seems like a flaw to me and the creatures just do not look right.

Usability would need some more thought, not all of the images/texts are immediately understandable.
Perfect balance of occupational tasks you can check back on periodically, but not enough to absorb you completely so you can get plenty of other tasks done.

I've played quite a few of these desktop idle games and since I discovered them, I usually have 1-3 running in the background at a time haha. This is by far one of the best ones I've played so far! There is soooo much to do, so many different animals with different colors and rarities. There is breeding to get better rarities, so many upgrades, plus decorations to buy, and a good bit of achievements to earn. You can have multiple "pastures" so you can hold more and more and more animals and not feel like you have to sell any of your rarest or favorite ones. The DLC is also totally worth it, you can turn any of your pastures into aquariums and keep fish! Which includes sooooo many new species and so many new decorations and items to buy. 

The devs are super responsive on their discord chat too. Overall, I'm very happy with this game and I would have paid more than they are asking for it. It's basically a full size cozy game hidden in a desktop idle background game. I cannot wait to get any future DLC that they may release, the animals are sooo cute. My only wish is for mermaids in the aquarium though. :D

Imagine trying to code and those little buddies just run around on the bottom of your screen supporting (and distracting, but mostly supporting) you in your journey.
10/10 would recommend to anyone who needs breaks during making projects
the game that you can sit and relax

Look, it is always running on my desktop... 

and it will forever :3
such a good & cute idler game, i like the artstyle
Great if you like to click on cute pixel animals in between spreadsheets :)
Super cute and relaxing!  10/10 would recommend.
Very cute, I love the panda and red pandas :)
:) Only played the base content, and it is still fun.
Cute little animals running around on the desktop
I love passively caring for lil cuties (bonus: halloween update!)

Oh hey! I didn't actually review this and I thought I did long ago. This is such a cute little game, a great idler, something nice to have on the bottom of the screen.

So the pros:
- The animals are, largely, cute. 
- If you have a favorite animal, you can get that animal up, through rainbow breeding, to millions of coins if you want. This means there are no animals that 'go to waste'. If you want little corgis running around and red pandas posing: you can do that. It's a lot of work... it's a LOT of hours, but there comes a point where you generate so much gold that this is easily done.
- The props are pretty nice and the automated stuff will truly automate things with only a bit of loss.
- The fish DLC is pretty nice, there are a things I'd like with that, but overall I like it. The water effect is cool where it dips where you put your mouse cursor at the top like you are dipping it in water and I like that. 
- The screen options are really nice, you can have a massively zoomed in farm or an itty-bitty farm with all your critters and props. 
- The constant collabs give some really cool creatures, they don't give a ton so they aren't broken, but even cosmetic animals can be bred higher if you want.
- The color variants are pretty nice and none of them are bad.

The things I'd like possibly looked at:
- The water stuff: I'd love more water variants. I posted in the forums but I'd love a water version the bees in the form of hermit crabs, or the broom could be snails. Things like that so we can make a real aquarium.
- Some of the props actually have use, but I'd love it if all of them did. Like maybe the Corgi jumps on the bench, or the rabbit and cat hide under it.

The biggest thing I'd like: 
- When there are a bunch of animals on the farm it would be nice if we could click them and milk for coins from the menu, or... and this is a big one: If we could have a little window in the farm where we could have the petting and clicking animations. We have the ability to turn off coin collecting so we can just pet them, but when you have a ton of animals it could be hard. I'd love to have them bigger on my screen, just a little one wandering in a window that I can click on. Think Dogz and Catz from the Windows 3.1 days. I really think this game could have a DLC just for that. Let us raise an animal and then pull that into it's own little sub window with some props, it can wander and we can pet it. In fact, as a punishment, in the pen it doesn't generate gold but can still need feeding and stuff. Imagine chilling with the Capybara just chilling while we pet it but taking up a third of our screen?  

Yeah... yeah I'd pay for that. I have, actually, as I bought Dogs and Catz many times. You have so many cute animals here that it could be fun.

There is a lot I like and very, VERY, little I don't. This isn't just a recommended game as I've actually forced it on friends by sending it to multiple of them. I kind of feel like anyone who likes animals or idlers would like it.
Tiny Pasture is easy to play . Have it on in the background .

A nice little idle game, would love to see more decor added in the future and just a few QOL updates (like make animals disappear when placing decor objects and longer names). About 275hrs is what it took to finish achievements, but I wasn't running anywhere near an optimized setup.
cute animals and no guns
super cute and relaxing
fun to sit back and relax
Adorable cute little guys look at them
Really cute game, im farming durning watching YT
Soooo cute!! x Amazing to have while watching YouTube or something ~

Cozy
Cute
Collecting
Pixel art
Relaxing
Idler

One complaint only. Need more Pastures.
Cute. Fun. Lovely. Who doesn't love a desktop pet?
this game is so cute !! wish the pet names could b longer
Lovely little creatures XD

This game is SUPER CUTE idle game! 100% worth it
very cozy and simple
Cute and addicting
I'm happy I discovered this game on a past sale.
Sin m√°s, lo dejas ah√≠ en la parte de abajo y hace sus cosas
I'm obsessed with this game, it's so cute!!
Super cute desktop overlay
Cozy idle and easy to 100%
There are bunnies. Cute idle game. üêáüëå
My boss does not know I'm raising slimes at work. 100% recommended.
nice chilling game
I have not played a lot, but when I have some studying to do or watching a video on YouTube, I love that I have some friends to take care of.
Best idle game ever played
its a fun thing to do when killing time
a great game! very comfy.
Fun and cozy.
cute & cozy
good game yessirski
cute and relaxing
Game santai sambil kerja
Just play and chill.

negative.review:
It pains me to thumbs down this game.  I'm not sure if I'm dumb, or if the page is actually misleading.  I got this to have a cute simulation of some cute animals on the bottom of my screen, to eventually unlock more and maybe some decorations.  The first tag on this game is Idler, and maybe I'm too stupid to know what an Idler is as it's not a genre I go for, but I thought I could leave an idle game idle. NO.  Not at all.  

I booted this up, absolutely loved the cute bunnies hopping around, and I imagined if I keep them fed they will make me coins, and maybe less coins if I didn't get around to feeding them.   I raved about how cute it was to my friend, sending them screenshots cause I was so delighted with the graphics and animations.  I didn't realize there is a PUNISHMENT if you don't watch them like a newborn human child. I don't feel like the page description accurately tells you this.

I left it running, went about some stuff in my day, came back to a screen full of poop and all my animals sick.  I couldn't afford medicine, and the only option to heal them is to get them well fed and a clean pasture and they will very, very slowly start to heal.  Too slowly, all the while you need to feed and clean or they won't heal.  They also make no coins during this time.  I left it on intending to return after an hour to clean and feed and hopefully see some improvement in health, but once again I have a life and it was left on too long and now I'm back to poops and 0% health.  Time to uninstall.  $5 down the drain.

I believe you can unlock items that will automate this for you down the line, but I have no desire to grind out hours to that point.

It's SO cute, but this is not at all what I was looking for.  If the devs add a setting toggle for a "fun" experience, ie. no poop, no sickness, no starving etc. just a fun thing you can leave running without maintenance, then I will be back to enjoying cute animals on my screen.  I downloaded this to add some joy, not to give myself another stress :\

how can such a tiny, simple thing be so bugged? Few content, lots of grind. Yes, the few available graphics are cute and charming. But the game breaks as soon as another window is opened simultaniously. Suddenly naming does not work, breeding does not work, managing lanes does not work. Awful boring grind just to get into more boring grind. This is not what I expected from a 'cozy' 'game'. Not even a real clicker. Screen easily gets cluttered when you have more than 10 animals in one lane. Breeding for achievement is an inconsistent waste of life time. Any shimeji ten years ago had more functionality. Few background and costumizability. 
Takes a surprising amount of energy, badly optimised as well.
loved it until the bug that causes it to crash on second screen broke it :(
Meeeh

Listing it as an idler, but punishing you for being idle is a very strange choice. If you leave for too long, everyone gets sick, and you're honestly better off selling all your cute friends and replacing them with fresh, healthy friends. I wanted to care for my little pets like buddies, but the game punishes you for doing that.

It pains me to thumbs down this game.  I'm not sure if I'm dumb, or if the page is actually misleading.  I got this to have a cute simulation of some cute animals on the bottom of my screen, to eventually unlock more and maybe some decorations. I left it running, went about some stuff in my day, came back to a screen full of poop and all my animals sick.  I couldn't afford medicine, and the only option to heal them is to get them well fed and a clean pasture and they will very, very slowly start to heal.  Too slowly, all the while you need to feed and clean or they won't heal.  They also make no coins during this time.  I left it on intending to return after an hour to clean and feed and hopefully see some improvement in health, but once again I have a life and it was left on too long and now I'm back to poops and 0% health.  Time to uninstall.  $5 down the drain.

I believe you can unlock items that will automate this for you down the line, but I have no desire to grind out hours to that point.

It's SO cute, but this is not at all what I was looking for.  If the devs add a setting toggle for a "fun" experience, ie. no poop, no sickness, no starving etc. just a fun thing you can leave running without maintenance, then I will be back to enjoying cute animals on my screen.  I downloaded this to add some joy, not to give myself another stress :\

Was looking for an idle game that can do things on it's own with minimal gameplay, but this ain't it. It's cute but trying to get coins so you can buy more animals and things is time consuming. You need to constantly click on the animals or they will get "full" form coins and won't collect anymore. Then you also need to click and drag on them to make them produce more coins. A little too much effort than what I'm looking for when I'm working from home.

It's cute.  It's fun.  It's idle.  But that Steam Achievement that involves unlocking all pasture slots takes literal hundreds of hours to unlock.  I need 7.2 billion dollars for the last slot for the achievement and I feel the fun of the game has been stripped.  I actually don't want to click play any more.  Steam is saturated with cute idlers, maybe try a different one.

Half the mechanics are useless, you can exploit bug, the progression dont really have logic. Great for 4yo not for adult with QI > 60.
The creator should know basic math and use of excel. 

But it take me a little time cause its cute. But really should be 2-3‚Ç¨. Not 4-6....

You need to constantly click on the animals or they will get "full" form coins and won't collect anymore. Then you also need to click and drag on them to make them produce more coins. A little too much effort than what I'm looking for when I'm working from home.

It's cute.  It's fun.  It's idle.  But that Steam Achievement that involves unlocking all pasture slots takes literal hundreds of hours to unlock.  I need 7.2 billion dollars for the last slot for the achievement and I feel the fun of the game has been stripped.  I actually don't want to click play any more.  Steam is saturated with cute idlers, maybe try a different one.

ÊâãÊÑü‰∏çÂ§™Ë°åÊ¨∏ÔºåËá™Âä®ÂåñÁöÑÊÑüËßâ‰∏çÂº∫ÔºåÂä®Áâ©Ë∑ëÊù•Ë∑ëÂéªÁöÑ‰ºöÊå°Âú®‰∏ÄËµ∑ÁÇπ‰∏çÂà∞ÂæàÁÉ¶...
ÊÑüËßâÂ∞±ÊòØÊ≤° Rusty's RetirementÂ•ΩÁé©

Half the mechanics are useless, you can exploit bug, the progression dont really have logic. Great for 4yo not for adult with QI > 60.
The creator should know basic math and use of excel. 

But it take me a little time cause its cute. But really should be 2-3‚Ç¨. Not 4-6....

how can such a tiny, simple thing be so bugged? Few content, lots of grind. Yes, the few available graphics are cute and charming. But the game breaks as soon as another window is opened simultaniously. Suddenly naming does not work, breeding does not work, managing lanes does not work. Awful boring grind just to get into more boring grind. This is not what I expected from a 'cozy' 'game'. Not even a real clicker. Screen easily gets cluttered when you have more than 10 animals in one lane. Breeding for achievement is an inconsistent waste of life time. Any shimeji ten years ago had more functionality. Few background and costumizability. 
Takes a surprising amount of energy, badly optimised as well.
loved it until the bug that causes it to crash on second screen broke it :(
Meeeh

Listing it as an idler, but punishing you for being idle is a very strange choice. If you leave for too long, everyone gets sick, and you're honestly better off selling all your cute friends and replacing them with fresh, healthy friends. I wanted to care for my little pets like buddies, but the game punishes you for doing that.

It pains me to thumbs down this game.  I'm not sure if I'm dumb, or if the page is actually misleading.  I got this to have a cute simulation of some cute animals on the bottom of my screen, to eventually unlock more and maybe some decorations.  The first tag on this game is Idler, and maybe I'm too stupid to know what an Idler is as it's not a genre I go for, but I thought I could leave an idle game idle. NO.  Not at all.  

I booted this up, absolutely loved the cute bunnies hopping around, and I imagined if I keep them fed they will make me coins, and maybe less coins if I didn't get around to feeding them.   I raved about how cute it was to my friend, sending them screenshots cause I was so delighted with the graphics and animations.  I didn't realize there is a PUNISHMENT if you don't watch them like a newborn human child. I don't feel like the page description accurately tells you this.

I left it running, went about some stuff in my day, came back to a screen full of poop and all my animals sick.  I couldn't afford medicine, and the only option to heal them is to get them well fed and a clean pasture and they will very, very slowly start to heal.  Too slowly, all the while you need to feed and clean or they won't heal.  They also make no coins during this time.  I left it on intending to return after an hour to clean and feed and hopefully see some improvement in health, but once again I have a life and it was left on too long and now I'm back to poops and 0% health.  Time to uninstall.  $5 down the drain.

I believe you can unlock items that will automate this for you down the line, but I have no desire to grind out hours to that point.

It's SO cute, but this is not at all what I was looking for.  If the devs add a setting toggle for a "fun" experience, ie. no poop, no sickness, no starving etc. just a fun thing you can leave running without maintenance, then I will be back to enjoying cute animals on my screen.  I downloaded this to add some joy, not to give myself another stress :\

Was looking for an idle game that can do things on it's own with minimal gameplay, but this ain't it. It's cute but trying to get coins so you can buy more animals and things is time consuming. You need to constantly click on the animals or they will get "full" form coins and won't collect anymore. Then you also need to click and drag on them to make them produce more coins. A little too much effort than what I'm looking for when I'm working from home.

It's cute.  It's fun.  It's idle.  But that Steam Achievement that involves unlocking all pasture slots takes literal hundreds of hours to unlock.  I need 7.2 billion dollars for the last slot for the achievement and I feel the fun of the game has been stripped.  I actually don't want to click play any more.  Steam is saturated with cute idlers, maybe try a different one.
